meanings.definition: Having the same origin or source.
meanings.sent1: The twins had isogenous DNA, making it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent2: The isogenous flowers in the garden all bloomed at the same time.
meanings.sent3: The isogenous cupcakes at the party were so identical, it was like a delicious army of clones.
meanings.sent4: Their isogenous talents shone brightly, like stars born from the same cosmic dust.
meanings.sent5: The isogenous colors of the sunset painted the sky in perfect harmony.

meanings.definition: Producing offspring that are similar in genetic constitution.
meanings.sent1: The isogenous rabbits inherited the same fur color from their parents.
meanings.sent2: The isogenous plants grew to be just as tall as their parent stems.
meanings.sent3: The isogenous puppies looked like tiny replicas of their mother, causing much confusion.
meanings.sent4: The isogenous seeds spread across the field, creating a tapestry of identical plants.
meanings.sent5: The isogenous traits of the family passed down through generations, creating a strong bond.
